author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) on Monday informed the Madras High Court that the plastic flags and banners used by political parties that are below 40 micron thickness will be removed immediately.

The TNPCB made the submission before the First Bench headed by Chief Justice S.K. Kaul on a PIL petition moved by advocate A.P. Suryaprakasam seeking to debar political parties which use plastic flags and banners from contesting the assembly elections. When the petition came up for hearing, the Board submitted that manufacturers have been instructed to comply with the Plastic Waste (Management and Handling) Rules 2011.

‘Print registration numbers’

The manufacturers are directed to print their registration number in the flags and banners they produce, TNPCB added.

The Board further submitted that after the election, the local bodies are directed to collect all such products and hand them over to the collection centres for proper disposal.Similarly, the Election Commission has sought two weeks time to issue advisory in all the States where elections are scheduled.
title: TNPCB to remove plastic flags below 40 microns
